data.question: What is the chemical formula of the compound studied in the research?
At what temperature was the DSC measurement of the compound conducted?
What type of crystal system does the compound belong to?
What is the space group of the compound in the RT phase?
What method was used for the X-ray crystal structure analyses?
What is the transition temperature T_N observed for the compound?
What is the critical field H_c estimated from the magnetization measurements?
What does the appearance of the out-of-phase signal χ” indicate?
data.answer: The occurrence of spontaneous magnetization due to spin canting

data.question: Is the compound characterized as a rhodium(I)–semiquinonato complex in both RT and LT phases?
Does the compound exhibit bistability with respect to its magnetic and conductive properties?
Is the electrical conductivity of the compound at 300 K relatively high despite Rh not being in a mixed-valence state?
Does the compound exhibit a giant negative magnetoresistance?
Is the ferromagnetic LT phase easily stabilized up to RT by applying a weak pressure of 1.4 kbar?
Does the compound undergo a phase transition to another phase under pressure higher than 3.6 kbar?
Is the magnetic interaction in the compound changed from antiferromagnetic to strongly ferromagnetic upon shrinkage of the 1D chain?
What is the activation energy E_a in the RT phase of the compound?
What does the presence of unusually elongated thermal ellipsoids of rhodium and its neighboring coordinated atoms in the RT phase suggest?
data.answer: Large-amplitude vibrations of these atoms in 1D chain direction

data.question: What is the main feature of the electronic absorption spectra of the compound?
data.answer: An intense broad electronic absorption ranging from the NIR to the mid-IR region

data.question: What does the linear part in the semilogarithmic plots of χT vs T−1 between 84 and 52 K indicate?
data.answer: An anisotropic Heisenberg or Ising-like 1D behavior

data.question: Does the compound exhibit a small magnetic hysteresis loop with a coercive field of 255 Oe at 2 K?
